author: Dingo
comment: DF on PC is the best fix around for hopelessly broken Nvidia surround, this app is a  companion to that program. In that context it works flawlessly, with plenty of gravy functions on the side. My only thought on how this app could be improved, would be to add a widget where we could place the most used  functions for quick and easy access, but that is certainly not enough to dock a star. :)

author: David Lewis
comment: Only thing that is very useful about this app is the ability to run custom scripts. So if you can program (C# cause VB is trash lol) then you can make great use of this. The only custom scripts that I've used is to shutdown my PC, make it sleep or troll friends with random messages on the screen lol. If i ever need it do something else, i love the ability to add it myself. To the average user, it's not entirely useful. In theory though, this app can virtually do anything so for that I'll give 4 stars.
title: Seems more for programmers than end users

author: Adam Kroupa
comment: Love it, I am using it to remotely launch certain programs (TeamViewer if I want to control my PC and I am in work or other place, I just run a custom script and bam, my program is running.) Also using it for locking my windows+ putting my monitors to sleep, really awesome (it's one of the custom scripts that you can download in the desktop DIsplayFusion). Only bad thing is that I am using it on my smartwatch too (Sony Smartwatch 3) and I have one problem. Whenever I open the app from the smartwatch it asks me to open the program on mobile phone first.. Which is kinda redundant because if I am already on my phone, in the DisplayFusion app, I don't need to use my watch anymore. Could you please look into it? I would really love to just touch my smartwatch and be able to sleep monitors quickly. Thanks a lot and keep up the great work!

author: Jonathon Barrow
comment: It provides you access to some basic settings on you're DF Desktop (advanced settings/tweaking not accessible). However it doesn't have anything that stands out. Widgets would be a good idea. Just noticed the compatibility with Tasker. It's a solid start with plenty of room to expand. Keep it up guys :)

author: Kimberly Balduf
comment: Honestly, there's no practical use for this. I love the main program, but this seems like dev money wasted on a pointless product. I can mess with settings, enable/disable stuff, but honestly... why do it from my phone/tablet? I have to be able to see the PC anyway to do any of this, I'll just sit down and do it if I really really need to change any of the settings. Don't waste your time, it's not a view/control the computer remotely type of remote. It's like a TV remote with all the good buttons gouged out by your baby brother. Better to just walk up to your TV or get a different remote.

author: Mark Dermendzin
comment: This has got to be the very best app for controlling your monitors when you have both of the monitors being used with thing that your doing.   When your playing a game and or watching you tube, using a chat program or whatever else you do with your other monitor it's nice to be able to open this app and use the endless options that it has without disturbing the programs your running.  I am giving this app 5 stars because it's nice to have the options that this app has even if I may not ever use one or two of the options. Its still nice to have every option when I want it.   Well done to the person or persons that made this app. Thank you for giving me all the greatness this app has to offer.

author: Daniel Strom
comment: Either a widget or an intent consumer that works with manual intent launcher, either one would do the job. Ability to use parameters with scripted functions would also be welcome. A list of open windows and their states would also be useful, with the ability to select one to open/close/max/etc the selection.
title: Please add support for shortcuts

author: Rounak Dutta
comment: I never noticed that this was included with my display fusion license. Like why? But hey the custom C# scripts work as intended, well this is geared more towards the devs and I love that (being a dev myself)
title: I never noticed.

author: Steven Zabala
comment: it keeps shutting down on me 1 star actually no star

author: Uroš Vovk
comment: You could add an option for favorites actions. Maybe you can add buttons instead dropdown list ;)
title: Love it

author: Bruce Arnold
comment: Great app, I just wish there were widgets for commonly used actions.

author: Daniel Danciu
comment: Awesome appreciate that is made even better by the remote functionality!

author: Jeremy Banks
comment: I use it to change monitor profiles from my living room, to enable/disable my primary screen mirror and change audio outputs. Now if I could have a widget to switch profiles with one press I'd be overwhelmed with joy.
title: Please add widgets

author: Dexter R
comment: Can use most of the hotkey functions. But please add more remote friendly functions like mouse and keyboard remote or sleep/shutdow  function. Most of the available remote tools are rather useless since they are really only usefull if you are sitting at the computer
title: Good

author: Nicholas DiMoro
comment: I cannot for the life of me understand why this app doesn't include the ability to shut down your computer remotely. Please, devs, add this feature and I'll change my rating.
title: The one useful feature is not included...

author: Thomas Zamudio
comment: I thought this would give me control of my mouse cursor, but it only allows you to snap the cursor to specific spots on the screen... Add that function and this will be a 5-star hands down!

author: Thomas Edwards
comment: Only downloaded because I thought I could access my volume mixer via this app.
title: Needs audio controls

author: ZEEK
comment: Needs a favorite commands section and widgets for quick use.
title: Good Start

author: Scott N
comment: Such a well rounded app there is no point to it! At least not yet.  It needs functionality people might need in a remote such as volume control or at least remote shutdown. only reason i think I'd use this app is simply to troll someone using my computer.

author: Jed Dye
comment: I saw someone writing "amazing, I can now change my PC wallpaper from across the room from my phone"... wtf??? You're THAT lazy?? What's the point really of this app??
title: App works great however, it is totally pointless

author: Jean-Luc Aubert
comment: Thank you very much guys, working nicely, already a lot of very useful features. My only regret so far is the fact that it only seems to work in portrait mode, it makes sense on a phone, but with a tablet (especially a big one, I have a Galaxy Note Pro 12") it would be wonderful to be able to use the app in landscape mode too - not complaining, just a little request for the future :) )
title: Very nice :)

author: Madam Questing
comment: This has so much potential and works great as a starting point. Hope so hard it becomes a way to access my desktop while away.
title: Look forward to more

author: Michael Boyd
comment: Needs thing like ability to control the mouse precisely and adjust volume.  Unless functions like that are added, its not very useful.  If I am tweaking settings, I do it siting at computer, not on the couch.
title: Good start but...

author: Joseph Tubbert
comment: It's a shame, this app doesn't work for me, and I don't know why, possibly because my PC is on a wired network while my tablet is obviously running on the Wi-Fi...  but regardless I can't get the app to detect the monitor.  Guess it's a good thing I don't need it
title: A Shame....

author: Bill Frederick
comment: I use DisplayFusion Pro software, but I can't determine what this app is supposed to do. What address am I supposed to enter? Doesn't make sense.

reply.author: Binary Fortress Software
reply.content: This is the companion app for DisplayFusion running on your Windows desktop computer. It's a remote control app, not a standalone product.

title: New App?

author: Braeden Long
comment: I was to lazy to set it up but its probably good
title: Um

author: Michael Kennedy
comment: ...  But I'm not really sure why I'll need this. I'll be looking into the updates.
title: Nice start

author: Chris Stauffer
comment: Wow. This runs very well, hard to believe it's an initial beta release. A lot of this functionality I don't really see myself using, but the scripting has me *very* interested. Would like to see some functionality like adjusting volume (when I've walked away from my computer and music is blaring). Can't wait to see what becomes of this app!
title: Awesome!

author: Tim Visée
comment: This app is brilliant, and works perfectly fine as soon as the 'Remote' feature is enabled in the settings on the desktop client. The app already has a lot of features, even for a first release. Can't wait to see what will become of this app once more features are added.
title: Brilliant!

author: Susan Dennis
comment: I can now change the wallpaper on my desktop computer using my phone (MotoX) across the room from the desk!  There is a 'Remote' section of the desktop program. You have to turn on the function by checking the box and click on Apply. Then, on your phone, hit refresh and it will find the desktop and ask for the security code which is listed just below the checkbox. Fill that in and bam! you are in business.  There are tons of things you can do but I'm distracted by pretty pix right now.
title: Soooooo cool

author: Rob Hayes
comment: Is it possible to integrate some of the functions into a custom Unified Remote remote?  DF Remote is missing a turn monitors on/off function.
title: Thanks

author: Metod Kolar
comment: just a hint GUI would be so much better
title: nice implementation

author: Ben Abbott
comment: If you could remotely control the mouse or even see the screen then that would be a useful function. Who really needs to control their wallpaper or move windows on their phone?
title: Not useful

author: Pieter Ouborg
comment: I imagine installing this on a buddy's PC would be great to mess with them, but other than that I find setting things up "the old fashioned way" works best for me..
title: Fun but to me rather useless

author: Jeff Myer
comment: Tried everything including troubleshooting and still couldn't connect to my computer.
title: IP problem

author: And Apps
comment: WiFi only... should mention that.  Big companies don't have phones on same network as computers
title: WiFi only

author: Donna Beaudoin
comment: this app SUCKS
title: displayfusion remote

author: Justin Byrne
comment: Not bad. Pretty cool
title: Nice!
